authority-number-renew-vary.header: What are your customer reference and current authority numbers?
authority-number-renew-vary.summary-header: How can I find the customer reference and authority numbers?
authority-number-renew-vary.details: Your customer reference number can be found beneath the address on your authority letter. The authority number can be found at the bottom left of the letter.

company-name.header: What type of organisation is the authority for?

handle.header: What will be handled under the authority?
handle.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

obtain.header: How will the prohibited items be obtained?
obtain.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

import.header: Will any of the prohibited items be imported?
import.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

storage.header: Will the prohibited items be stored on the business's premises in the UK?
storage.important: The information you provide here will replace the information on your existing authority, so enter the details of all business premises that will be used to store the prohibited items.

usage.header: What business activities will be carried out with the prohibited items?
usage.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

weapons.header: Which sections do the weapons or components fall under?
weapons.intro: Select all that apply and state the maximum quantities held at any one time. If the sections and quantities aren't backed up by the evidence provided, it may delay the application or result in the authority not being approved.
weapons.important: Only in certain circumstances, such as transporting prohibited items under seal, should you select the unspecified option or leave the maximum quantity questions blank.

ammunition.header: Which sections does the ammunition fall under?
ammunition.intro: Select all that apply and state the maximum quantities held at any one time. If the sections and quantities aren't backed up by the evidence provided, it may delay the application or result in the authority not being approved.
ammunition.important: Only in certain circumstances, such as transporting prohibited items under seal, should you select the unspecified option or leave the maximum quantity questions blank.

authority-holders.header: How many individuals will be named on the authority?
authority-holders.important: If the details you provide here are different to those on your existing authority, the details on your existing authority will be replaced.

authority-holders.one: What's the full name of the authority holder?
authority-holders.two: What's the full name of the first authority holder?

second-authority-holders-name.header: What's the full name of the second authority holder?

contact.header: Who do we contact about this application?
contact.important: The contact details you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

storage-postcode.header: Where will the prohibited items be stored?
storage-postcode.intro: You can add further addresses later, if required. The police will inspect the storage arrangements at each location.
storage-postcode.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

storage-address-lookup.header: Where will the prohibited items be stored?
storage-address-lookup.intro: You can add further addresses later, if required. The police will inspect the storage arrangements at each location.
storage-address-lookup.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

storage-address.header: Where will the prohibited items be stored?
storage-address.intro: You can add further addresses later, if required. The police will inspect the storage arrangements at each location.
storage-address.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

contact-details.intro: A confirmation email of this application will be sent to this address.

contact-holder.first: Which address should we use to contact {{values.first-authority-holders-name}}?
contact-holder.second: Which address should we use to contact {{values.second-authority-holders-name}}?

contact-holder.first: Which address should we use to contact {{values.first-authority-holders-name}}?
contact-holder.second: Which address should we use to contact {{values.second-authority-holders-name}}?

contact-holder.first: Which address should we use to contact {{values.first-authority-holders-name}}?
contact-holder.second: Which address should we use to contact {{values.second-authority-holders-name}}?

storage-add-another-address.header: Is there another address where the prohibited items will be stored?
storage-add-another-address.important: The information you provide here will replace the information we currently hold.

confirm.intro: Check your answers and make any necessary changes before you submit this application
confirm.footer: You'll be able to print and save a copy of the information you've submitted on the next page
confirm.declaration: By submitting this application you agree that:
items: there are no physical or mental health conditions that should prevent any employees and authority holders from handling the prohibited items
the information you've given is correct
the Home Office can share relevant information with the police and HMRC
HMRC can share relevant information with the Home Office

subject.customer: Your email confirmation - application to handle prohibited weapons, components or ammunition

customer: This email confirms receipt of your application to handle prohibited weapons, components or ammunition. We will review the application, and get back to you at this email address if we require further information.

If sufficient information and suitable evidence has been provided, weâ€™ll instruct the local police force to make enquiries on behalf of the Secretary of State. In this case, the police will contact you regarding security inspections and interviews.
The decision on your application is pending. This email is not a certificate of authority.
If you need to contact us about this application, or believe you have received this email by mistake, contact the Home Office's firearms licensing unit using the details below.

confirmation.email: We have sent an email to {{values.contact-email}} to confirm receipt of your application.
confirmation.evidence:
You must provide evidence to support the business activities, types and quantities of weapons requested to be covered by the authority.

You must send the evidence to us by post or email, clearly referencing your business name and customer reference number if you have one.

Your evidence should include:

items: invoices from within the last 6 months
letters of sponsorship from within the last 6 months
a valid import licence, if relevant
details of any third party storage arrangements, if relevant

confirmation.register: You also need to supply us with a register of the guards employed by the company and their personal details, including:

items: Residential addresses covering the last 5 years
DBS certificate (optional) - must be no more than 4 months old

confirmation.evidence-send:
Email: firearms.applications@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk

Or post copies to:

Firearms licensing unit
Home Office
Fry Building, 5th floor, SE
2 Marsham Street
London
SW1P 4DF
confirmation.next:
We will review your application and if more information is required, we shall email the contact address provided.

If sufficient information and suitable evidence has been provided, weâ€™ll instruct the local police force to arrange a visit.
confirmation.feedback: What did you think of this service? (takes 30 seconds)
